title: Is He Living or Is He Dead?
description: “Is He Living or Is He Dead?” is one of the best-known humorous stories by Mark Twain (pen-name of Samuel Clemens, 1865-1936). First published in 1893, it is centered around the paradoxal story of an artist that stages his death in order to increase the value of his works.  This edition also contains a selection of Twain’s best aphorisms and a biographical note on the author.
author: Mark Twain
